channel.title: Equivalence :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we will revisit the notion of equivalence. In chapter 2, we saw how we could use truth tables to show that two logical formulae are equivalent. Here, we will see that we can also show they are equivalent using our natural deduction proof rules. Semantic equivalence We saw in section 2.4 that two (or more) logical statements S1 and S2 were said to be semantically equivalent if and only if:
